ShouldersDBLyingLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying Lateral Raise
ShouldersDBLyingLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell in front of thigh.
ShouldersDBLyingLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from floor until arm is vertical. Maintain fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersDBLyingLateralRaise.comments: Dumbbell is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation.

ShouldersDBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell One Arm Seated Lateral Raise
ShouldersDBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on stool or end of bench with legs together. Position dumbbell to side with elbow slightly bent. Angle torso slightly forward and place free hand on end of thigh for support.
ShouldersDBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain elbows height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
ShouldersDBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. As elbow drops lower than wrist, front deltoid becomes primary mover instead of lateral deltoid. See Lateral Raise Errors.

ShouldersDBSeatedUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Seated Upright Row
ShouldersDBSeatedUprightRow.preparation: Sit on end of bench with legs far apart. Grasp dumbbell between legs with arm vertical under shoulder. Position torso slightly forward with hand on knee for support.
ShouldersDBSeatedUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading out to side. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersDBSeatedUprightRow.comments: When dumbbell is raised, wrist should be in front or just below of shoulder elbow should be to side, not too pointing forward. See Upright Row Safety. Also see Dumbbell One Arm Upright Row in standing position.
ShouldersDBSeatedUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersDBRaises.name: Dumbbell Raise
ShouldersDBRaises.preparation: Stand and grasp dumbbells with arms to side, palms facing sides of thighs.
ShouldersDBRaises.execution: Pull dumbbells up to sides of ribs with elbows out to sides. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersDBRaises.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrist can be flexed, extended, or keep neutral.
ShouldersDBRaises.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, deltoidposterior, supraspinatus, brachialis, trapeziusmiddle, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersDBLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
ShouldersDBLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in front of thighs with elbows slightly bent. Bend over slightly with hips and knees bent slightly.
ShouldersDBLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersDBLateralRaise.comments: Keep elbows pointed high while maintaining slight bend through elbows (10 to 30 angle) throughout movement. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Dumbbells are raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. If elbows drop lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids. To keep resistance targeted to side delt, torso is bent over slightly. See other view and Lateral Raise Errors.

ShouldersDBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell One Arm Lateral Raise
ShouldersDBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Position dumbbell in front of pelvis with elbow slightly bent. Grasp stationary object with other hand for support. Bend over with hips and knees bent slightly.
ShouldersDBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain elbows height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
ShouldersDBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10 to 30 angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. As elbow drops lower than wrist, front deltoid become primary mover instead of lateral deltoid. See Lateral Raise Errors.

ShouldersDBOneArmUprightRow.name: Dumbbell One Arm Upright Row
ShouldersDBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells with palms facing front of thighs. Position other hand for support.
ShouldersDBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
ShouldersDBOneArmUprightRow.comments: See Upright Row Safety. Also see Seated Upright Row.
ShouldersDBOneArmUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor

ShouldersDBInclineLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Lateral Raise
ShouldersDBInclineLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand. Lie on 30 to 45 incline bench with opposite side of body on incline, arm over top of bench, lower leg positioned on front side of seat, and upper leg on back side of seat. Position dumbbell inside of lower leg, just in front of upper leg.
ShouldersDBInclineLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from until upper arm is perpendicular to torso. Maintain slight fixed bend in elbow throughout exercise. Lower dumbbell to front of upper leg and repeat.
ShouldersDBInclineLateralRaise.comments: In order for lateral deltoid to be exercised, dumbbell must be raised by shoulder abduction, not external rotation. Also see exercise Dumbbell Incline Lateral Raise performed on preacher bench.

ShouldersDBUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
ShouldersDBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells and stand with palms facing front of thighs.
ShouldersDBUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to front of shoulder with elbows leading out to sides. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbells rise upward. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersDBUprightRow.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrists should be in front or just below of shoulders elbows should be to sides, not pointing forward. See Upright Row Safety.
ShouldersDBUprightRow.synergists: infraspinatus, brachioradialis, serratusanterior, bicepsbrachii, brachialis, supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidanterior, trapeziuslower, teresminor
